N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2208.3 - Procedures

State Regulations
(a) Agreement. Upon
selection as a successful candidate, and as a condition to the receipt of any
annual payment, the recipients shall execute a written agreement with the
corporation, which agreement shall set forth the recipient's obligations to
practice medicine in a shortage area designated pursuant to Education Law, section 605(9)(a)(3), and in accordance with these rules. Such agreement shall
also provide for the recipient to repay any funds received and such other
amounts that may be due as provided by law in the event he or she shall fail or
refuse to complete the service obligation. (b) Application. To receive an annual payment
each recipient shall submit a complete application for such payment to the
corporation. Such application shall be in such form as required by the
president and shall include but not be limited to the name, social security
number, home and business address of the recipient, the name of the lender of
each eligible loan, the original loan amount, the school and course attended at
the time such loan was made, the repayment schedule for such loan and the
number and amount of any annual payments received under this section. (c) Payment. Upon acceptance of a recipient's
payment application and the corporation's assurance that the recipient has
complied with any required, prior service obligation hereunder, the corporation
shall make the annual award payment to the recipient. The period of service
associated with such payment shall commence following receipt of such payment. Disbursement of the second annual payment shall be dependent upon successful
completion of the first year's service. (d) Reporting. Annually, commencing with the
calendar year in which a recipient begins to perform his or her service
requirement at such time and in such form as the president shall prescribe, a
recipient shall report to the corporation regarding the performance of the
service requirement. This report shall be separate from the annual payment
application. Notes
